member.name: T:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.ErrorCode
member.summary: Errors which can be raised by the advertising SDK when making an ad request.

member.name: F:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.ErrorCode.InvalidRequest
member.summary: The ad request is invalid. The localizedFailureReason error description will have more details on the invalid parameter(s).

member.name: F:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.ErrorCode.NoFill
member.summary: The ad request was successful, but no ad was returned.

member.name: F:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.ErrorCode.NetworkError
member.summary: There was an error loading data from the network.

member.name: F:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.ErrorCode.OSVersionTooLow
member.summary: The current device's OS is below the minimum required version.

member.name: T:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.AdException
member.summary: This exception is thrown or passed in events as the result of ad request errors.

member.summary: Error code summarizing error

member.name: T:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.WPF.DisplayAdBase
member.summary:
Supplies the underlying behavior of an ad control.
The Google advertising SDK tries to pull a number of facets about the user and their device automatically. Some of these pieces of data require specific rights or flags to be set. If the flags are not set or the application does not request these permissions, these piece of information will not be used for ad targeting:
GPS Position - Requires ID_CAP_LOCATION and AllowAutomaticGpsLocation = true Device Unique ID - Requires ID_CAP_IDENTITY_DEVICE

member.summary: Requests a new ad

member.returns: The forced size of the ad control

member.summary: Overrides the ArrangeOverride behavior to force control to be the correct size
member.returns: The forced size of the ad control

member.name: E:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.WPF.DisplayAdBase.AdLoading
member.summary: Sent when a new ad is being requested.

member.name: E:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.WPF.DisplayAdBase.AdReceived
member.summary: Sent when an ad request loaded an ad. This is a good opportunity to ensure the ad view is visible and in the display area.

member.name: E:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.WPF.DisplayAdBase.AdFailed
member.summary: Sent when an ad request failed. Normally this is because no network connection was available or no ads were available (i.e. no fill).

member.name: E:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.WPF.DisplayAdBase.AdPresentingScreen
member.summary: Sent just before presenting the user a full screen view, such as a browser, in response to clicking on an ad. Use this opportunity to stop animations, time sensitive interactions, etc.

member.name: E:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.WPF.DisplayAdBase.AdLeavingApplication
member.summary: Sent just before the application will background or terminate because the user clicked on an ad that will launch another application (such as the Marketplace).

member.name: T:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.WPF.BannerAd
member.summary: Control for standard 480 x 75 banner ad.
member.remarks: The size of this ad is fixed. If too much space is allocated the ad may have blank space around it. If too little space is allocated the ad may not be functional and ad-revenue may be affected.

member.name: M:Google.AdMob.Ads.WindowsPhone7.WPF.BannerAd.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new 480 x 75 banner ad.
